crcl.utils

Class CRCLSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • crcl.utils.CRCLSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class CRCLSocket
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Class user for reading and writing CRCL xml data via an java.net.Socket.
    Author:
    Will Shackleford <william.shackleford@nist.gov>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CRCLSocket.UnaryOperator<T>
      The class exists for previous pre- Java 8 code.

        public static final int DEFAULT_PORT
        Default TCP port to connect to or bind. 64444

        public CRCLSocket(@Nullable Socket socket)
        Create a new CRCL socket wrapped around the given java.net.Socket
        Parameters:
        socket - socket used to send and receive CRCL data

      • CRCLSocket

        public CRCLSocket(String hostname,
                  int port)
           throws CRCLException,
                  IOException
        Create a new CRCLSocket connected to the given host and port via TCP.
        Parameters:
        hostname - name of computer running the CRCL server
        port - port number of CRCL server
        Throws:
        CRCLException - CRCL schemas could not be found or are invalid
        IOException - host or port invalid or network unavailable

      • getUtilSocket

        public static CRCLSocket getUtilSocket()
        Create a utility socket if it does not already exist. It connects to nothing but is useful for string conversions etc. Multiple calls to this will return the same object.
        Returns:
        new or existing utility socket.

      • parseMultiCommandString

        public List<crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType> parseMultiCommandString(String s)
                                                                throws CRCLException
        Parse a string that may contain multiple or partial XML CRCLCommandInstances, and return a list of those commands. Partial commands are saved and used as a prefix to the string passed in the next call to this function.
        Parameters:
        s - String that may contain multiple XML CRCLCommandInstances
        Returns:
        list of CRCLCommandInstances from strings so far.
        Throws:
        CRCLException - if the string is invalid

      • parseMultiCommandString

        public List<crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType> parseMultiCommandString(String s,
                                                                       boolean validate)
                                                                throws CRCLException
        Parse a string that may contain multiple or partial XML CRCLCommandInstances, and return a list of those commands. Partial commands are saved and used as a prefix to the string passed in the next call to this function.
        Parameters:
        s - String that may contain multiple XML CRCLCommandInstances
        validate - validate each instance against the schema.
        Returns:
        list of CRCLCommandInstances from strings so far.
        Throws:
        CRCLException - if the string is invalid

      • parseMultiStatusString

        public List<crcl.base.CRCLStatusType> parseMultiStatusString(String s)
                                                      throws CRCLException
        Parse a string that may contain multiple or partial XML CRCLStatusTypes, and return a list of those status messages. Partial commands are saved and used as a prefix to the string passed in the next call to this function.
        Parameters:
        s - String that may contain multiple XML CRCLStatusTypes
        Returns:
        list of CRCLStatusTypes from strings so far.
        Throws:
        CRCLException - if the string is invalid

      • readCommand

        public crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType readCommand()
                                              throws CRCLException,
                                                     IOException
        Wait to be sent one command and construct a new command object from the CRCL data.Additional optional validation will not be done. The default timeout is used.
        Returns:
        new command received
        Throws:
        CRCLException - a parsing failure
        IOException - a network failure

      • getDefaultSoTimeout

        public int getDefaultSoTimeout()
        Get the default timeout used on blocking socket operations. The timeout is in milliseconds and a timeout of 0 is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Returns:
        default timeout

      • setDefaultSoTimeout

        public void setDefaultSoTimeout(int defaultSoTimeout)
        Set the default timeout used on blocking socket operations. The timeout is in milliseconds and a timeout of 0 is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
        Parameters:
        defaultSoTimeout - new value of default timeout

      • readCommand

        public crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType readCommand(boolean validate)
                                              throws CRCLException,
                                                     IOException
        Wait to be sent one command and construct a new command object from the CRCL data.The default timeout is used.
        Parameters:
        validate - do additional optional validation
        Returns:
        new command received
        Throws:
        CRCLException - a parsing failure
        IOException - a network failure

      • readCommand

        public crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType readCommand(boolean validate,
                                                     int soTimeout)
                                              throws CRCLException,
                                                     IOException
        Wait to be sent one command and construct a new command object from the CRCL data.
        Parameters:
        validate - do additional optional validation
        soTimeout - timeout in milliseconds or use 0 for infinite timeout
        Returns:
        new command received
        Throws:
        CRCLException - a parsing failure
        IOException - a network failure

        public List<crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType> checkForCommands(boolean validate)
                                                         throws CRCLException
        Check to see if one or more commands have been received without blocking or waiting.
        Parameters:
        validate - do additional validation
        Returns:
        possibly empty list of commands received since the last call.
        Throws:
        CRCLException - invalid data was received

        Throws:

      • writeCommand

        public void writeCommand(crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType cmd)
                  throws CRCLException
        Convert the command object to CRCL xml format without additional validation and send over the socket.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to send
        Throws:
        CRCLException - command is invalid or network fails Note: Exceptions only occur when the command cannot be sent or is detected as invalid according to the schema on this side of the socket. Failures on the robot or simulation result in a CRCL_ERROR in the status message read separately.

      • writeCommand

        public void writeCommand(crcl.base.CRCLCommandInstanceType cmd,
                         boolean validate)
                  throws CRCLException
        Convert the command object to CRCL xml format and send over the socket.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to send
        validate - do additional validation
        Throws:
        CRCLException - command is invalid or network fails Note: Exceptions only occur when the command cannot be sent or is detected as invalid according to the schema on this side of the socket. Failures on the robot or simulation result in a CRCL_ERROR in the status message read separately.

      • writeCommand

        public void writeCommand(crcl.base.CRCLCommandType cmd)
                  throws CRCLException
        Convert the command object to CRCL xml format without additonal validation and send over the socket.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to send
        Throws:
        CRCLException - command is invalid or network fails Note: Exceptions only occur when the command cannot be sent or is detected as invalid according to the schema on this side of the socket. Failures on the robot or simulation result in a CRCL_ERROR in the status message read separately.

      • writeCommand

        public void writeCommand(crcl.base.CRCLCommandType cmd,
                         boolean validate)
                  throws CRCLException
        Convert the command object to CRCL xml format and send over the socket.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to send
        validate - do additional validation
        Throws:
        CRCLException - command is invalid or network fails Note: Exceptions only occur when the command cannot be sent or is detected as invalid according to the schema on this side of the socket. Failures on the robot or simulation result in a CRCL_ERROR in the status message read separately.

      • writeWithFill

        public void writeWithFill(String str)
                   throws IOException,
                          InterruptedException
        Write a string which should already be in CRCL xml to the underlying socket. An additional trailing byte may be added. Note: It is generally safer and easier to use writeCommand, writeProgram or writeStatus instead.
        Parameters:
        str - string to send
        Throws:
        IOException - network failure
        InterruptedException - this thread was interrupted during the operation

      • writeProgram

        public void writeProgram(crcl.base.CRCLProgramType prog,
                         boolean validate)
                  throws CRCLException

        Parameters:
        prog - program to send
        validate - do additional validation
        Throws:
        CRCLException - command is invalid or network fails Note: Exceptions only occur when the command cannot be sent or is detected as invalid according to the schema on this side of the socket. Failures on the robot or simulation result in a CRCL_ERROR in the status message read separately.

      • cmdToString

        public static String cmdToString(crcl.base.CRCLCommandType cmd)
        Convert the command object to a string representation useful for logging or compact displays. It converts a maximum of 12 fields and truncates the string after 60 characters.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to convert
        Returns:
        new string

                          int max_fields,
                          int max_length)
        Convert the command object to a string representation useful for logging or compact displays.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to convert
        max_fields - maximum number of fields in the command to include before truncation
        max_length - maximum length of the string which may require truncation

      • newCRCLSocketForSocketSchemas

        public static CRCLSocket newCRCLSocketForSocketSchemas(@Nullable Socket socket,
                                                       @Nullable Schema cmdSchema,
                                                       @Nullable Schema statSchema,
                                                       @Nullable Schema programSchema)
        Create a new CRCL socket wrapped around the given java.net.Socket and cmd,stat and program schemas.
        Parameters:
        socket - socket used to send and receive CRCL data
        cmdSchema - schema for commands
        statSchema - schema for status
        programSchema - schema for programs
        Returns:
        new CRCLSocket object

      • newCRCLSocketForSocketChannel

        public static CRCLSocket newCRCLSocketForSocketChannel(SocketChannel socketChannel)
        Create a new CRCL socket wrapped around the given java.nio.channels.SocketChannel
        Parameters:
        socketChannel -
        Returns:
        new CRCLSocket object

      • newCRCLSocketForHostPortSchemas

        public static CRCLSocket newCRCLSocketForHostPortSchemas(String hostname,
                                                         int port,
                                                         Schema cmdSchema,
                                                         Schema statSchema,
                                                         Schema programSchema)
                                                  throws CRCLException,
                                                         IOException
        Create a new CRCLSocket connected to the given host and port via TCP and using the given schemas for parsing/generation.
        Parameters:
        hostname - name of computer running the CRCL server
        port - port number of CRCL server
        cmdSchema - schema for commands
        statSchema - schema for status
        programSchema - schema for programs
        Returns:
        new CRCLSocket object
        Throws:
        CRCLException - CRCL schemas could not be found or are invalid
        IOException - host or port invalid or network unavailable
